alert.note: Alert for Outagamie; Waupaca; Waushara; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:04AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Winnebago, eastern Waushara, southern Waupaca and southwestern Outagamie Counties through 700 AM CDT... At 603 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hartman Creek State Park to near Redgranite to 6 miles southeast of Montello to near Lake Wisconsin. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Waupaca and Lake Poygan around 620 AM CDT. Fremont around 635 AM CDT. New London around 640 AM CDT. Oshkosh around 645 AM CDT. Appleton, Menasha, Central Lake Winnebago and Northern Lake Winnebago around 700 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Pickett, Butte Des Morts, Larsen, Lake Butte Des Morts, Northport, Orihula, Rivermoor, Borth, Winneconne and Zittau. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
